titleStmt.title: The dyctes and the sayenges of the philosophers other wyse called Dicta philosophorum
Dicta philosophorum. English
titleStmt.author: Mubashshir ibn Fātik, Abū al-Wafāʼ, 11th cent.
Guillaume, de Tignonville, d. 1414.
Rivers, Anthony Woodville, Earl, 1442?-1483.

publicationStmt.publisher: in Fletestrete at the sygne of the sonne by me Wynkyn de Worde,
publicationStmt.date: in the yere our lorde M.CCCCC.xxviii. [1528].

notesStmt.note: A translation by Anthony Woodville, Earl Rivers, of Guillaume de Tignonville's French version of "Dicta philosophorum" by Abū al-Wafāʼ Mubashishir ibn Fātik, originally written in Arabic.
Imperfect: the copy of this work at reel 46:1 is badly damaged, with much loss of text. The copy at reel 2348:14 is a replacement, in which quire C is misbound, partly interleaved with quire B.
Reproductions of the originals in: British Library (reel 46:1) and Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Galler (reel 2348:14).

place.placeName: Fletestrete at the sygne of the sonne
